data.title: Privacy Policy
data.text:
Please read this Privacy Policy carefully before using this website at https://www.chescowellbeing.com or https://chescowellbeing.com (“Service” or “Site”) operated by Chester County Well-Being LLC ​​(“Company”, “us”, “we”, or “our”).

Who we are

Our website address of Service is: http://www.chescowellbeing.com or https://chescowellbeing.com.

The legal name of the business is: Chester County Well-Being LLC.

Please contact us by completing the contact form here if you have any questions or concerns.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the Site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address, and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms (if applicable)

Should you use the contact form (which may or may not be present on any webpage) to submit a response/comment/message, the information you provided will be collected which may include the name given, the email given, and the comment/message given, but is not limited to this information. Your information is collected in order to contact you in reply. No guarantee is made that you will be contacted in reply.

Your information will not be shared with third-party companies for marketing purposes.

Cookies

This section explains what cookies are and how we may or may not use them, the types of cookies we may or may not use, the information we may or may not collect using cookies and how that information may or may not be used.

This Site uses cookies to improve your experience while you navigate through this Site. Out of these, the cookies that are categorized as necessary are stored on your browser as they are essential for the working of basic functionalities of the website. We also may use third-party cookies that help us analyze and understand how you use this website. These cookies will be stored in your browser only with your consent (see below). You also have the option to opt-out of these cookies. But opting out of some of these cookies may affect your browsing experience.

Consent of cookies

By visiting this Site, a cookie notification banner was presented to you for 10 seconds and you have had the opportunity to accept all cookies or to customize the cookies you do or do not accept. If you did not accept all cookies or customize what you accepted within the 10 seconds the cookie notification banner was present, you have agreed to accept all cookies as stated in the cookie notification banner.

Your consent applies only to this Site.

Your current state: No consent given. Manage your consent.

If you have any questions or concerns about this, please contact us by completing the contact form here.

Information about cookies

Cookies are small text files that are used to store small pieces of information. They are stored on your device when the website is loaded on your browser. These cookies help us make the website function properly, make it more secure, provide better user experience, and understand how the website performs and to analyze what works and where it needs improvement.

As most of the current online services, this Site may use first-party and third-party cookies for several purposes. First-party cookies are mostly necessary for the website to function the right way, and they do not collect any of your personally identifiable data.

The third-party cookies that may or may not be used on this Site are mainly for understanding how this Site performs, how you interact with this Site, keeping our services secure, providing advertisements that are relevant to you, and all in all providing you with a better and improved user experience and help speed up your future interactions with this Site.

Type of cookies we may or may not use

Essential: Some cookies are essential for you to be able to experience the full functionality of this Site. They allow us to maintain user sessions and prevent any security threats. They do not collect or store any personal information.

Statistics: These cookies store information like the number of visitors to this Site, the number of unique visitors, which pages of this Site have been visited, the source of the visit, etc. These data help us understand and analyze how well this Site performs and where it needs improvement.

Marketing: This Site does not currently display advertisements. No cookies are used for marketing purposes.

Functional: These are the cookies that help certain non-essential functionalities on this Site. These functionalities include embedding content like videos or sharing content of this Site on social media platforms.

Preferences: These cookies help us store your settings and browsing preferences (if applicable) like language preferences so that you have a better and efficient experience on future visits to this Site.

The below list details the cookies that may or may not be used in our Site.

Changing cookie preferences

Should you decide to change your preferences later through your browsing session on this Site, you can click on the “Manage Cookie Settings” tab at the bottom of this Site. This will display the consent notice again enabling you to change your preferences or withdraw your consent entirely.

In addition to this, different browsers used by you to access this Site provide different methods to block and delete cookies used by websites. You can change the settings of your browser to block/delete the cookies. To find out more about how to manage and delete cookies, visit wikipedia.org, www.allaboutcookies.org.

Additional consent of cookies (if applicable)

If you leave a comment on the Site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address, and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one (1) year.

If you visit the Site login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two (2) days, and screen options cookies last for one (1) year. If you select “Remember Me”, your login will persist for two (2) weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after one (1) day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on the Site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Information about you may be collected and used by third-party analytic plugins for marketing purposes. This data may be used to determine how you found the Site, what device was used, and other relevant information in order to optimize future marketing for the Company.

Who we share your data with

If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

NEED TO UPDATE BELOW

The Site is hosted on SG Hosting Inc. (“SiteGround”) who may or may not collect and store your data. Please read their Privacy Policy here:

https://www.siteground.com/viewtos/privacy_policy.

Emails services are provided through SG Hosting Inc., Hover by Tucows Co., and through Gmail of Google LLC of Alphabet Inc. who may or may not collect your information.

Please read their Privacy Policies here:

SiteGround: https://www.siteground.com/viewtos/privacy_policy

Hover: https://www.hover.com/privacy

Gmail: https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

The information you provide in the contact form will be kept for a minimum of one (1) year, unless you request your information not to be kept for this period or beyond one (1) year.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on the Site, or have left comments, or submitted information using the contact form, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Additional information

How we protect your data

Administrators can only access your information through password protected logins.

UPDATE BELOW AND BRING TO ONE PARAGRAPH

The Site is protected through SiteGround Security measures not limited to SSL and HTTPS. Additional security may or may not be enabled through third-party WordPress security plugin(s) in order to further unsure protection of your information.

What data breach procedures we have in place

In the event of a data breach, either potential or real, such as internal reporting systems, contact mechanisms, or bug bounties, we will notify you as soon as possible once the breach has become known.

What third parties we receive data from

Nothing to declare.

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Nothing to declare.

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

Not applicable.

Contact Us
